message.content:
We begin by calculating the ratios one‐by‐one using the values provided in the problem.

1. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio  
 • Definition: Main Business Revenue (or Total Revenue) / Average Accounts Receivable  
 • Accounts Receivable at beginning = 0.00 and at end = 248540.09  
 • Average Accounts Receivable = (0 + 248540.09) / 2 = 124270.045  
 • Revenue = 791992.51  
 • Ratio = 791992.51 / 124270.045 ≈ 6.38  

2. Operating Cash Flow Ratio and Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio  
 • Both ratios here are calculated as: Operating Cash Flow / Total Current Liabilities  
 • Operating Cash Flow (Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities) = –4504752.68  
 • Total Current Liabilities = 3389719.66  
 • Ratio = –4504752.68 / 3389719.66 ≈ –1.33  
  (Thus, both ratios are –1.33)

3. Total Asset Turnover Ratio  
 • Definition: Revenue / Average Total Assets  
 • Total Assets at beginning = 16000000.00, at end = 19501451.49  
 • Average Total Assets = (16000000.00 + 19501451.49) / 2 = 17750725.745  
 • Revenue = 791992.51  
 • Ratio = 791992.51 / 17750725.745 ≈ 0.0446  
  Rounded to two decimal places, this is approximately 0.04

4. Debt to Equity Ratio  
 • Definition: Total Liabilities / Total Owner’s Equity  
 • From the balance sheet, Total Liabilities and Owner’s Equity = 19501451.49 and Total Owner’s Equity = 16111731.83  
 • Therefore, Total Liabilities = 19501451.49 – 16111731.83 = 3389720 (approximately equal to the Total Current Liabilities field)  
 • Ratio = 3389719.66 / 16111731.83 ≈ 0.2105  
  Rounded, we get approximately 0.21

Thus, the computed ratios are as follows.

{
  "solution": {
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "6.38",
    "operating cash flow ratio": "-1.33",
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-1.33",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.04",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.21"
  }
}
